content:
ICS 1C: References

"ECC" indicates print version is available at Engineering Copy Center, 203 ET.
  • Text = The World Wide Web Unleashed by John December and Neil Randall
  • As We May Think,V. Bush, 1945. -- ECC Also, hypertext version
  • World-Wide Web Home
  • ``What Does W3 Define?''
  • Guide to Cyberspace -- ECC
  • World Wide Web FAQ (Frequently Asked Questions) (UCI Copy for ICS 1C).
  • Dictionary of Hypertext Terms
  • URLs and ``Naming'' Resources on the Web
  • HTML References
    • A Simple Sample of HTML and how it looks in plain (``ASCII'') text.
    • NCSA's Beginner's Guide to HTML -- ECC
    • University of Kansas's HTML Quick Reference (02/14/95) -- ECC
    • Hypertext Markup Language (HTML) Home Page from the W3 Consortium.
    • Composing Good HTML -- ECC
    • Crash course on writing documents for the Web -- ECC
    • Clarkson's HTML Tutorial -- ECC
    • University of Toronto's HTML Documentation
    • James Powell's ``Introduction to HTML'' (UCI Copy for ICS 1C).
  • HTML Forms, a specialized and (``advanced'') part of HTML
    • University of Kansas's ``Instantaneous Introduction to HTML Forms.'' (UCI Copy for ICS 1C). -- ECC
    • NCSA Forms Overview -- ECC
  • NSFnet Internet Statistics from Georgia Tech's GVU Center.
  • New Spiders Roam the Web by John December.
  • MOMspider, Maintaining Distributed Hypertext Infostructures. -- ECC
  • College and University Home Pages
  • Hypertext Webster Dictionary Interface from Carnegie-Mellon University.
And, of course, for those who don't like stucture:
  • The Full ICS 1C Documentation Directory Dump.
This information brought to you by www.ics.uci.edu
Current as of 12 February 1995
